sentence.Network_en: It only takes one sperm to fertilize an egg.
sentence.Network_cn: 只需要一个精子就能让卵子受精。

sentence.Network_en: They hauled feedlot manure from the ranches to fertilize their fields.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们从牧场的饲养场拖走肥料去肥田.

sentence.Network_en: It is important to match varieties in order that they may cross - fertilize.
sentence.Network_cn: 要配置的授粉品种必须是能互相授粉的.

entry.def: When an egg from the ovary of a woman or female animal is fertilized, a sperm from the male joins with the egg, causing a baby or young animal to begin forming. A female plant is fertilized when its reproductive parts come into contact with pollen from the male plant.

example.ex: Certain varieties cannot be fertilised with their own pollen.
example.tran: 某些物种只能异花授粉。

example.ex: ...the normal sperm levels needed to fertilise the female egg...
example.tran: 能让卵子受孕所需的正常精子水平

entry.def: To fertilize land means to improve its quality in order to make plants grow well on it, by spreading solid animal waste or a chemical mixture on it.

example.ex: The faeces contain nitrogen and it is that which fertilises the desert soil.
example.tran: 粪便含氮，而正是氮可以肥化荒芜的土地。

means.word_mean: 1. provide with fertilizers or add nutrients to;

sentences.sentence: "We should fertilize soil if we want to grow healthy plants"

auth_sentence.content: Some scientists suspect the deadly E. coli might have been in manure used to fertilize vegetables.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some scientists suspect the deadly E. coli might have been in manure used to fertilize vegetables.

auth_sentence.content: These "new" sperm might still be able to fertilize an egg, but they can contain dangerous mutations.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: These "new" sperm might still be able to fertilize an egg, but they can contain dangerous mutations.

auth_sentence.content: After 90 days, a high-quality organic compost is ready for landscapers, farmers and gardeners to fertilize their soil.
